job_title: Anonymous Employee in Shawnee, KS
pros: -Great team environment on certain shifts. -Got a lot of good experience from working here. -Certain co-workers were awesome to work with and so willing to help.

job_title: Cardiac Sonographer in Mission, KS
pros: Nice coworkers, the manager is very sweet. The doctors are nice and easy to work with. The medical benefits are generally good if you stay within their network. The pay is good.
cons:
The workload is too much and violates ICAEL standards. They expect 8-12 echos a day. However, the true expectation is to not leave any exams over until the next day. For example, if you are doing outpatients and have 15 minutes until your next outpatient, the charge nurse will want to call an impatient down for you. They clearly do not value patient care nor the health of their sonographers. They would rather have a poor echo today than a good one tomorrow. 

The 401K is quite poor. They only match at the end of the year and you do not become vested until you are there for five years. If you leave after 4 years, 11 months your vesting in their contribution is zero.

review_title: Good place to work as long as you don't need a raise
job_title: Registered Nurse in Merriam, KS
pros: Good reputation. Good place to work.
cons: Pay is below standard.  Once you are employed you will not get raises based on your performance.  Only have seen 1 raise in 3+ years (no one is getting raises).  Patient loads are heavier than other competing hospitals.  They offer free food to all the doctors and the other staff has to pay for theirs with a very small discount.

review_title: Great staff of people, who in general, care very much for the patients.
job_title: Cardiac Sonographer in Shawnee, KS
pros: It is a very clean hospital with excellent physicians and support staff. I get the opportunity to work OT, which I like, others choose not to. It is a very busy hospital, I have never felt insecure about my employment status. Compensation is competitive with other area hospitals.
cons: Leadership is in Orlando, FL. There have been several days where the entire staff is overwelmed do to over schedualing and under staffing/resources. This, I feel, affects the way we care for patients in a negative way. Benefits have decreased and seem to be on the low end with area hospitals.

review_title: Not a bad place to work

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Merriam, KS
pros: The team that is present will support each other. Nice to help patients and families. Have special days for employees like strawberry festival and Christmas dinner. Overtime, Bonuses and shift differential.
cons: Employees would call in sick and no replacement help. Need to be perfect to get bonus, perfect RQA, perfect on bio-metrics and perfect collections. When you didn't get a bonus and asked questions just brushed off, no way to learn from your mistakes.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Shawnee, KS
pros: Good pay and nice hospital to work in. Good training and excellent orientation. Felt very welcomed and supported. Open door policy. Could ask for help and express concerns.
cons: Not enough staff nurses. Assignments were always heavy and you were run off your feet. Always too many patients and no time for breaks. Because of heavy pt load you would feel unsafe.

review_title: It is an OK place to work if you are not looking to climd the ladder fast.
